    • Uses of SerializationException in i5.las2peer.tools

      Methods in i5.las2peer.tools that throw SerializationException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static XmlAble XmlTools.createFromXml(java.lang.String xml, java.lang.Class<?> c)
      this method goes through the three possible standard deserialization methods defined in XmlAble to try to deserialize an XmlString into an instance of the given class
      static XmlAble XmlTools.createFromXml(java.lang.String xml, java.lang.String classname)
      create an XmlAble java object from its xml representation
      static java.io.Serializable CryptoTools.decryptAsymmetric(byte[] data, java.security.PrivateKey key)
      decrypt the given content with the given private key and try to deserialize the resulting byte array
      static java.io.Serializable CryptoTools.depryptPassphaseObject(byte[] content, byte[] salt, java.lang.String passphrase)
      descrypt (and deserialize) the given encrypted data using the given passphrase and salt
      static java.io.Serializable SerializeTools.deserialize(byte[] bytes)
      deserialize a single Object from a byte array
      static java.io.Serializable SerializeTools.deserialize(byte[] bytes, java.lang.ClassLoader clsLoader)
      deserialize a single Object from a byte array
      static java.io.Serializable SerializeTools.deserializeBase64(java.lang.String base64)
      decodes a given base64 encoded string and deserializes it into a java object
      static javax.crypto.SecretKey SerializeTools.deserializeKey(byte[] bytes)
      try to deserialize a single Key from the given byte array
      static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptAsymmetric(java.io.Serializable content, java.security.PublicKey key)
      encrypt the given data after serialization using the given public key
      static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptSymmetric(java.io.Serializable plainData, javax.crypto.SecretKey key)
      encrypt the given object after serialization with the givne key
      static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptWithPassphrase(java.io.Serializable object, java.lang.String passphrase, byte[] salt)
      encrypt a serializable object using the given passphrase an salt make sure to use real random salts e.g. via the CryptoTools.generateSalt() method
